ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when a class could not be loaded usually 
because its static initializer threw an exception.

It's the most insidious of all Java exceptions because noone ever knows 
what it means (we get about 3 support calls about it a day) and it 
violates the convention that Errors represent a problem in the VM when 
its actually a user code problem.

Grrr.

Kevin

Jeff Grigg wrote:
> That's odd:  It looks to me like 'Class.forName' is throwing 
> a 'java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError' exception, instead of the 
> expected 'java.lang.ClassNotFoundException'.  Try catching 
> NoClassDefFoundError (too); maybe that will fix it.
> 
> --- "A.J. Bonnema" <abonnema@x> wrote:
> 
>>------------- ---------------- ---------------
>>Testcase: testOpenCloseDb(tierra.dbutils.DbAccessTest):    Caused 
> 
> an ERROR
